FOR SERVICES RENDERED January 1993

Environmental Tobacco Smoke

Worked with EPA policy officials to hold an interagency meeting on meta
analysis technology for ETS and EMF.

Began briefing other agency officials on the MBS/EPA interagency meeting on
ETS and EMF.

Determined the status of the risk assessment and plans for press conference
releasing the risk assessment from EPA staff working on the risk assessment
and from EPA press staff.

Researched the non-cancer risk assessment issues related to the children’s
respiratory effects section of the risk assessment and proposed a strategy for
pre-empting the release of the risk assessment on that issue. Drafted a press
statement to this effect.

Attended the EPA press conference on the risk assessment.

Drafted a letter to be submitted to the President concerning the Executive
order on smoking in Federal buildings.

Drafted and transmitted letters to John Bailar and Alvan Feinstein concerning
their participation in a meeting with EPA, DOE, NIEHS, CIRRPC and NCI
concerning the ETS precedents which will impact EMF.

Risk Assessment Activities

Commenced cataloging of existing ETS information for the purpose of
developing an automated reference system. .

Researched and discussed with EPA staff the science issues behind EPA’s
decision to phase out methyl bromide. Determined that no docket will exist
until the notice of proposed rulemaking is issued this summer or fall.

sample delivery, generating high levels of trial anong
STERLING' prime prospect group of 25-49 year old white

‘On behalf of R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company, I am most pleased to enclose a
contribution to your campaign fund. This contribution is being made based on the
recommendation of RUR's Florida legislative counsel, Larry Williams, and is in
recognition of your willingness to consider legislative issues fairly and objectively.

Your support of our country's free-market system will continue to create job opportunities
for the citizens of Florida. These qualities, as well as your leadership record, are the
reasons it isa pleasure to give you our support.

Explanatory Notes

The Tidsrock Corporation was instructed by The Tobacco Institute,
Inc., in Dec-mber 1967 to make a mass mailing of reprints of the
article, "To Smoke or Not to Smoke — That is Still the Question,”
which appear:id in the January 1968 issue of TRUE.

‘TMderock: directed the art work, setting of type, printing, and
mailing oper:tions.

Recogniving that some manufacturers desired additional copies
of the reprirt, Tiderock canvassed the companies, and bulk quantities
of the article were printed for manufacturers who requested them, on
the understanding that the companies would be billed, on a pro rata

basis, for the number they ordered.

The attached documents are intended to aid the accounting

personnel of The Tobacco Institute. .

Via Other Federal Agencies

+ Revised meta-analysis white paper covering ETS and EMF and accompanying
cover letter for review by ILSI officials.

+ Held telephone discussions with ILSI officials. Arranged lunch meeting with
appropriate officials. Wrote memo regarding the status of the ILSI project.

* Met with ILST official to discuss planned meta-analysis workshop. Discussed
composition of planning committee for the workshop. Briefed client on results
of meeting, preliminary timetable and possible members of planning
committee.

+ Researched the differences between ETS and MS described by EPA in their
ETS risk assessment.

* Reviewed the FDA draft "Redbook.”

* Drafted memorandum on FDA's regard for meta-analysis in its toxicological
standard for reviewing technical studies as part of food and color additive
approvals (Redbook).

* Initiated discussion with member of the interagency committee on smoking.

Via EPA

* Discussed the inclusion of ETS on the CRAVE agenda with two members of the
CRAVE committee, including one of the co-chairs.

* Drafted a submission with cover letter analysis on new evidence on ETS for
inclusion in the CRAVE reanalysis promised for this year in the Federal
Register; these materials included information on the plausibility argument,

FROM: = T. A. Clark
DATE: May 1, 1987
SUBJECT: SIDESTREAM ANALYSTS OF CAPRI/278

At your request, we analyzed nonmenthol CAPRI, Virginia Slim Lts., and
Marlboro Lts, for sidestrean and mainstream smoke deliveries. The
CAPRI cigarettes were taken from test market sampling. The Marlboro
Lts, and Virginia Slim Lts. came from competitive brand pickup. The
production date for the Virginia Slim Lts. is January, 1987, The
production date for the Marlboro Lts. is September, 1986. The CAPRI
Cigarettes used in these analyses were taken out of cold storage
April, 1987. No production date could be located for these
cigaretes. A total of 12 porta were smoked for each brand. The
particulate matter: water, nicotine free (PMnNP) vas calculated for
the eidestreas pads and chimneys, The PMWF 1s the same as tar
levels, The results of these analyses are summarized below:

 

SIDESTREAY

PRWNE PT MME Total
BRANDS Pad (ms/oig) Chimney (ma/eia) Totel (ma/ciz) Nicotine (nz/cia)
cape 16.4 3a 19.5 2.6
Va. Sims Lts. 22.3 3.3 25.6 37
Marlboro Lts. 26.0 3.3 29.3 aa

 

The total PMWE for CAPRI is 23.8% lower than that of Virginia Slims
Lts. and 33.4% lower than that of Marlboro Lts. The PMWNF (chimney)
renains fairly constant from one brand to the other. The total
sidestream nicotine for CAPRI 1s 29.7% lower than that of Virginia
Slins lite, and 40.9% lover than that of Marlboro Lts.

Three cigarettes vere snoked per pad on a Phipps & Bird smoking
machine at standard smoking conditions (35ce puff volume, 2 second
puff duration, and a puff interval of one minute) with a sidestream
flow of 2 Livers/uinute. A fishtail chimney with a Gelman pad
attached to the top of the chimney vas used to trap the sidestream Wet
Total Particular Matter (WIPM).

Dear Sir or Madam,

1am a 53 year old male born in 1946. I have been smoking Winston cigarettes
for 42 years, since age 11. Needless to say, I have been, and I am currently
addicted to your brand of cigarettes and nicotine.

Please allow me this opportunity to profile my smoking history for the past 42
years for purposes of edification.(I write this letter while going through the
withdrawal of nicotine addition for the 25% time). have been hypnotized
numerously, injected with various ‘blocker’ chemicals, used patches, joined
stop-smoking clubs, you name it... I have tried it all more than once. Now I'm
trying again, but this time I'm going to do it because quite frankly, I'm pissed
off...big time. You might be laughing saying to yourself,‘ so it took this klutz 42
years to figure out that nicotine is addictive’ ? Not on your life, Ive smoked and
knew I was addicted, because try as I might, I just couldn't quit. I went
through hell every time and put my family through hell as well.

Here is the bottom line, and you might take real hard notice, because it took me
so long to get mad, you can bet your ass that I'm now on a mission to stop you
from contaminating youngsters, (especially my new grandson) from becoming
addicted to tobacco. It seems as though money talks in this world, and you are
about to understand that one individual can cause as much financial pain than
your group of hotshot lawyers can defend. It's kinda like y'all have been lying to
the public and dancing around the truth all these years. Well gentlemen, I've
decided to play your little game and now I know the rules on how to play to win,

Enclosed is my first invoice for nicotine treatment for which you are solely
responsible. But standby boys, it’s about to get better.

By your own admission, you altered the amounts of nicotine and other additives
and now age a bullshit marking ploy that your brand of cigarettes are “100%
tobacco (W) no additives’. When does it all stop ? Will you go to no end to hurt

and keep'péople buying your product even though you know it hurts them and
the people around them ?

Re: — Unauthorized Use of WINSTON on Balloons

Gentlemen:

It has been brought to our attention that your firm is selling balloons that bear the well
known WINSTON trademark owned worldwide by R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company. We must
insist that this infringing activity cease immediately.

We are particularly concerned about the use of our WINSTON trademark on balloons since
these items could be purchased and used by children. It is our Company's policy not to sell or

advertise the sale of cigarettes to children. It is also our Company's policy not to allow the
unauthorized use of our trademarks on any products but especially on items which could be

purchased or used by children.

 

‘Your prompt written assurance that this infringing activity will cease will bring this matter
to a satisfactory conclusion. If we do not hear from your company within a reasonable time, we
vill turn the matter over to legal counsel in Taiwan and pursue our civil and criminal legal remedies

to the fullest extent.
Sincerely yours, -

TIDEROCK - TRUE ADVERTISEMENT

On December 13, Miss Moore (Rosser Reeves' secretary) called
to tell me that the billing on this advertisement was $468.59
less than the figures we had given to each of the companies
for their direct payment to Tiderock.

on December 14, Miss Moore called to say that the amount
above was not the complete billing since it did not include
the production costs. On December 21, she called with the
final production costs -- $1,112.14. The difference between
the credit due, per paragraph 1 and this amount was only
$643.55, and Tiderock made payment to the agency by their
check, leaving this $643.55 balance to be figured into later
billings for the individual company payments.

Ig you agree, this can now be added to the payments due on
the Barron's billings, thus clearing for now any payments due
from the companies direct to Tiderock. I have checked with

Mr. Wells and there are no anticipated billings to be considered
other than those which are now covered in our 1968 budget.

Final sheets, similar to the attached example, could be sent

to each of the companies involved, if you think it advisable.

The amounts we would now call on the companies for would be:

recommendation of FUR's Florida legislative counsel, Larry Williams, and is in

recognition of your willingness to consider legislative issues fairly and objectively
